snippet: There were few policy disagreements between Representative Charles B. Rangel and his primary challengers, but the latter group all agreed it was time for the congressman to go.
abstract: New York Rep Charles B Rangel engages in the first televised debate of his primary campaign against Democratic challengers State Sen Adriano Espillat, Clyde Williams, Joyce Johnson and Craig Schley; incumbent expresses conviction that he is still the best man for the job.
lead_paragraph: There were few policy disagreements between Representative Charles B. Rangel and his primary challengers, but the latter group all agreed it was time for the congressman to go.

headline.seo: At Primary Debate, Main Quarrel Is Whether Rangel Should Retire
headline.main: Debate’s Main Quarrel: If Rangel Should Retire
headline.print_headline: Debate’s Main Quarrel: If Rangel Should Retire
